Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy Omission in Breast Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to BCS with or without SLNB.

Participants.evidence: 1733 women with unilateral cT1–2 N0 invasive breast cancer were recruited between May 2015 and January 2022.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to BCS with or without SLNB.

Objective.evidence: assessing the oncological safety and impact on health-related quality of life (HRQoL) of omitting sentinel lymph node biopsy (SLNB)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was patient-reported arm function and HRQoL, measured up to 3 years post-inclusion

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 1733 women with unilateral cT1–2 N0 invasive breast cancer were recruited between May 2015 and January 2022.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 821 were analysed (392 with SLNB, 429 without SLNB) using an as-treated approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The SLNB group experienced a slight, temporary decline in arm function (P < 0.025) and more HRQoL arm and breast symptoms (P < 0.049).

Funding.evidence: Funding: Supported by the Netherlands Cancer Institute.
